fact_list.fact_text: Avoid dragging the engine by using the correct gear if you drive a manual vehicle.
Driving the vehicle in the right gear will increase fuel efficiency and reduce emissions.
Drive at a steady speed and avoid unnecessary acceleration or braking as much as possible.
Avoiding unnecessary acceleration and heavy braking helps reduce your vehicle’s fuel consumption.
Maintain a safe distance between your vehicle and the vehicle in front to avoid last-minute braking and to get up to speed as smoothly as possible.
Drive at a safe and steady speed.
Avoid setting your vehicle’s air-conditioning temperature too low and instead increase the fan speed in order to achieve higher fuel efficiency and reduce emissions.
Air-conditioning consumes a lot of fuel to keep you cool.
Plan your journey before setting off to avoid traffic congestion or getting lost on the roads.
Planning your journey can save you both time and fuel as well as reduce emissions.
